[Components]

Simple grid functionality for arranging items on the screen in rows and columns. More...

class  SmoothScrollInfo

Detailed Description

Simple grid functionality for arranging items on the screen in rows and columns.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from Control.

enum AbstractGrid::MoveDirection
 

Enumerator:
Left  Moving one cell to the left.
Right  Moving one cell to the right.
Up  Moving one cell up.
Down  Moving one cell down.
PageUp  Move one page up, which means that the first visible index is decreased by the number of full visible items.
PageDown  Move one page down, which means that the first visible index is increased by the number of full visible items.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AbstractGrid::AbstractGrid (  Control *  parent = 0  ) 
 

AbstractGrid::~AbstractGrid (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

void AbstractGrid::AssureVisibleSelection (  BOOLEAN  respect_scroll_gap = TRUE  )  [protected]
 

Assures, that the selected idx is fully visible by adjusting the first visible index when necessary.

Parameters:
respect_scroll_gap If set to TRUE, it is assured that the scroll gap defined by inside the class OptionalConfig is respected. When using block scrolling by pressing page up/down keys it might be useful that the scroll gap is not respected.

void AbstractGrid::CancelSmoothScrolling (  INT  new_selected_idx  )  [protected]
 

Cancels the smooth scrolling and sets the selected index to new_selected_idx. Using this method instead of AbstractGrid::SetSelectedIndex is useful if e. g. the whole content has been changed and no smooth scrolling is wanted in this case.

void AbstractGrid::DrawPositionIndicator (  const Rect &  repaint_rect  )  [protected]
 

Draws the positionindicator. Usually invoking this method is not required, as the drawing is done in AbstractGrid::OnPaint per default.

virtual INT AbstractGrid::GetCellCount (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns:
Defines the number of cells for the grid.

Implemented in Menu, AbstractItemGrid, CalendarGrid, and CalendarMonthSelector.

virtual XYDIM AbstractGrid::GetCellHeight (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns:
Defines the height of all cells.

Implemented in Menu, AbstractItemGrid, CalendarGrid, and CalendarMonthSelector.

Rect AbstractGrid::GetCellRect (  INT  idx  )  const
 

Parameters:
idx Index of the cell.
Returns:
Position and dimension of the inquired cell.

XYDIM AbstractGrid::GetCellWidth (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
Defines the width for all cells. -1 automatically sets the cell width depending on the number of columns.

Reimplemented in Menu, and CalendarGrid.

virtual INT AbstractGrid::GetColumnCount (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns:
Defines the number of columns for the grid.

Implemented in Menu, ItemGrid, ItemTree, CalendarGrid, and CalendarMonthSelector.

INT AbstractGrid::GetCompleteVisibleRowCount (   )  const
 

Returns:
The number of currently complete visible cells inside the grid. "Complete visible" means that they are not clipped.

INT AbstractGrid::GetFirstVisibleColumn (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
Index of the first visible column

INT AbstractGrid::GetFirstVisibleIndex (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
Index of the first visible cell.

XYDIM AbstractGrid::GetHeaderHeight (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
Defines the height of the header. Per default 0 is returned.

Reimplemented in AbstractItemGrid.

Rect AbstractGrid::GetHeaderRect (  INT  column_idx  )  const
 

Parameters:
column_idx Index of the header-column.
Returns:
Postition and dimension of the header. An empty rectangle is returned, if AbstractGrid::GetHeaderHeight returns a value <= 0.

INT AbstractGrid::GetLastCompleteVisibleIndex (   )  const
 

Returns:
Index of the last visible cell, which is not clipped.

INT AbstractGrid::GetLastVisibleIndex (   )  const
 

Returns:
Index of the last visible cell. This cell may be clipped.

INT AbstractGrid::GetRowCount (   )  const
 

Returns:
The number of rows, which is calculated due to using the methods AbstractGrid::GetCellCount and AbstractGrid::GetColumnCount.

ScrollBehavior AbstractGrid::GetScrollBehavior (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
The scrollbehavior defined in GuiEngineConfig::GetScrollBehavior, which represents the default scroll-behavior. This method may be overwritten if another scrollbehavior is wanted.

INT AbstractGrid::GetSelectedIndex (   )  const
 

Returns:
Index of the selected cell.

INT AbstractGrid::GetSelectedIndexProperty (   )  const [inline, protected]
 

Returns the selected index property. It is recommended to use the method AbstractGrid::GetSelectedIndex for getting the selected index, as a range check is done to assure that the selected index is always >= 0 and < the number of cells. Anyway derived controls might require the internal selected index property which might temporary be < 0 or >= the number of cells.

XYDIM AbstractGrid::GetSelectionHeight (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
The height of the selected item in pixels. Per default -1 is returned, which means that the height of the cell (see AbstractGrid::GetCellHeight) is used. The selection height is only respected, if the number of columns is 1 (see AbstractGrid::GetColumnCount).

Reimplemented in AbstractItemGrid.

const AbstractGrid::SmoothScrollInfo * AbstractGrid::GetSmoothScrollInfo (   )  const
 

Returns information about the smooth scrolling. 0 is returned if smooth scrolling is not enabled.

INT AbstractGrid::GetVisibleRowCount (   )  const
 

Returns:
The number of currently visible cells inside the grid. The cells might be clipped.

BOOLEAN AbstractGrid::HasHeader (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
TRUE, if the header should be shown. Per default FALSE is returned.

Reimplemented in AbstractItemGrid.

Parameters:
parent Control which embeds the AbstractGrid.

Reimplemented in CalendarGrid, and CalendarMonthSelector.

BOOLEAN AbstractGrid::IsPositionIndicatorLeftAligned (   )  const [protected]
 

Returns TRUE, if the position-indicator is aligned on the left side.

BOOLEAN AbstractGrid::IsPositionIndicatorShown (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
TRUE, if the position-indicator should be shown corresponding to the display-policy defined in OptionalConfig.

void AbstractGrid::MoveSelectedIndex (  MoveDirection  move_dir  )  [virtual]
 

After pressing an arrow-key this method is invoked with the corresponding move-direction as input-parameter. Sets the selected index and respects the scroll-behavior. This method may be overwritten if another behavior is wanted.

void AbstractGrid::OnSelectionChanged (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, each time the selector has been moved. The method also is invoked once when the parent-window containing the abstract grid is opened.

Reimplemented in Menu, AbstractItemGrid, and ItemMenu.

void AbstractGrid::SetFirstVisibleIndex (  INT  idx,
BOOLEAN  respect_scroll_gap = TRUE
) 
 

Parameters:
idx Index of the first visible cell.
respect_scroll_gap If set to TRUE, it is assured that the scroll gap defined by inside the class OptionalConfig is respected. When using block scrolling by pressing page up/down keys it might be useful that the scroll gap is not respected.

BOOLEAN AbstractGrid::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from Control.

Reimplemented in AbstractItemGrid, ItemGrid, ItemMenu, and ItemTree.

void AbstractGrid::SetSelectedIndex (  INT  idx  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the selected index to idx, invokes OnSelectionChanged and sends the message SelectionChangedMsg to the parent-window of the control

Parameters:
idx Index of the selected cell.

Reimplemented in AbstractItemGrid.

void AbstractGrid::UpdateNavigationGuidance (   )  [protected]
 

Updated the navigation guidance, which depends on the number of cells and columns.

Reimplemented from Control.

void AbstractGrid::UpdatePositionIndicator (   )  [protected]
 

Updates the position-indicator to indicate the position and visible section corresponding to the number of cells.
